intro: Hedyotis subcarnosa, commonly known as the narrowleaf pennywort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are tiny, yellowish-green, and clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
